column3:
Heh, I remember seeing the "mucho-data" thing, from whoever put that in in some PR, but I didn't realize it has actually made it in.

EDIT: Looks like it was @jgarzik, in a79342479f577013f2fd2573fb32585d6f4981b3
Wut? Why the hell was that merged?\n

Right, I remember I posted a mild protest in the pull, but didn't want to sound like the all-day-long nitter.\nEdit: After the merge I even started giving serious protests (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/be484db274e6de7e7b6880d04b2d84e20b719b9a) no one seemed to care...\n
data-size is perhaps confusing, since I'd expect that to be e.g. for txn >100kb. Would op-return-data-size be too verbose?\n
Agreed. "multi-op-return" was Gavin's proposal and makes sense.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/b34e88a88f8e8c0b73292853fbce73a5f86c7dcc for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
You guys have absolutely no sense of humor whatsoever.  :)  \n
